mods.abstract: A Picture History of Lockport 1835-1985 The locks, built in 1850, established a water route between Bayou Lafourche and New Orleans. Their width was 23 feet. Steamers would dock at the 'Port of Locks', a term which eventually provided the town with the name Lockport.

titleInfo.title: Louisiana Sea Grant Digital Images Collection

mods.note: Baker, Marjorie. A Picture History of Lockport. Dexter, MI: Thomson-Shore, 2007.
